CONTENTS.P: Procurement: 9062-IFT-43755
Project name: Tursun-Zade Solid Waste Project
Country: Republic of Tajikistan
Business sector: MEI
Project ID: 43755
Funding source: EBRD and EBRD SSF grant
Type of contract: Supply of Goods
Type of notice: Invitation for Tenders
Issue date: 13.4.2018
Closing date: 28.5.2018, 14:00 local time

This Invitation for Tenders follows the General Procurement Notice for this project which was published on the European Bank for Reconstruction and Development (the Bank) website, Procurement Notices (www.ebrd.com) on 12 April 2018.

Communal Enterprise “Shubai Manziliyu Kommunali va Khojagidori Dar Nazdi Makomoti Ijroiyai Hokimiyati Davlatii Shahri Tursunzoda” of Tursun-Zade City hereinafter referred to as “the Purchaser”, intends to use part of the proceeds of a loan from the Bank towards the cost of the Tursun-Zade Solid Waste Project.
The Purchaser now invites sealed tenders from Suppliers for the following Contract/s to be funded from part of the proceeds of the loan and a grant:
TZSW-OT-G03: Procurement of waste collection and general operation and maintenance vehicles:
— Lot 1: Sand-spreader truck, 7 m3, 1 truck,
— Lot 2: Pickup truck and towable disinfection unit, 1 truck and 1 disinfection unit,
— Lot 3: Truck with aerial platform, 22 m, telescopic, 1 truck,
— Lot 4: Rear loading waste compaction vehicle, 16 m3, 2 trucks.
Tenders are invited for one or more lots. Each lot must be priced separately. Tenders for more than one lot may offer discounts and such discounts will be considered in the comparison of tenders.
The delivery under each lot is required to be within 120 days from signing of the contract and all lots are to be implemented concurrently.
Tendering for contracts that are to be financed with the proceeds of a loan from the Bank is open to firms from any country.
To be qualified for the award of a Contract, Tenderers must satisfy the following minimum criteria:

1. The Tenderer, or any partner in a JVCA, shall not have a consistent history of litigation and/or arbitration resulting in awards against the Tenderer, or any partner in a JVCA, within the last five (5) years.

This determination shall be based solely on fully settled disputes or litigation. A fully settled dispute or litigation is one that has been resolved in accordance with the Dispute Resolution Mechanism under the respective Contract, and where all appeal instances available to the Tenderer have been
Exhausted.
2. All pending litigation shall in total not represent more than twenty percent (20 %) of the Tenderer’s net worth and shall be treated as resolved against the Tenderer.

3. Submission of audited balance sheets, or if not required by the law of the Tenderer’s country, other financial statements acceptable to the Purchaser, for years 2014, 2015, 2016 and 2017 (or forecasts for 2017, if accounts are not closed) to demonstrate the current soundness of the Tenderer’s financial position and its prospective long-term profitability.

4. The Tenderer must demonstrate access to, or availability of, financial resources such as free funds on current account, lines of credit dedicated to this project execution, or other similarly highly liquid financial means, in the amount not less than 90 % of the tender price per each lot to which the Tenderer applies. The Tenderer must demonstrate that the funds required for this project are free of its other commitments or sufficient to cover the overall cash flow requirements for this Contract and its current commitments
5. Experience as Supplier:
(a) Tenderer shall demonstrate that the offered type of Goods have been in the successful production and operation under similar conditions for at least last 3 (three) years, i.e. 2015-2017.

(b) Tenderer must demonstrate that they have experience as Supplier of the suggested item or similar Goods over the last 3 years, i.e. 2015-2017, under the contract/s that have been successfully and substantially completed. The similarity shall be based on the functions of machinery, complexity, methods / technology or other characteristics as described in Section VI, Supply Requirements.
Printed tender documents may be obtained from the office at the address below upon payment of a nonrefundable fee of 100 USD or equivalent in a convertible currency.
Account for TJS:
Шуъбаи манзилию коммунали ва хачагидории шахри Турсунзода
Корреспондентский счет 20402972316264
Филиал № 15 Амонатбанка в г. Турсунзаде
Account for US Dollars:
Shubai Manziliyu Kommunali va Khojagidorii shahri Tursun-Zade
Correspondent Account 20402972316264
Branch № 15 Amonatbonk in Tursun-Zade city

Upon receiving appropriate evidence of payment of the non-refundable fee, the documents will be promptly dispatched by courier, however, no liability can be accepted for loss or late delivery. Alternatively, if requested, the documents can be dispatched electronically as well free of charge.

Tenders must be delivered to the office at the address below on or before than 14:00 оn 28.5.2018, at which time they will be opened in the presence of those Tenderers’ representatives who choose to attend.
Address: 27 Shotemur Street
Tender Box Nº 2
City: Dushanbe
Postal Code: 734002
Country: Republic of Tajikistan,
State Committee on Investment and State Property Management of the Republic of Tajikistan.
The applicable procurement rules are the Bank’s Procurement Policies and Rules (PP and R) which can be located at:
http://www.ebrd.com/news/publications/policies/procurement-policies-and-rules.html
A register of potential Tenderers who have purchased the tender documents may be inspected at the address below.
Prospective Tenderers may obtain further information from, and also inspect and acquire the tender documents at, the following office:

ADDRESS_NOT_STRUCT.ATTENTION: Mr. Abdurashid Kamolov, Director of PIU
ADDRESS_NOT_STRUCT.ORGANISATION: Communal Enterprise “Shubai Manziliyu Kommunali va Khojagidori Dar Nazdi Makomoti Ijroiyai Hokimiyati Davlatii Shahri Tursunzoda” of Tursun-Zade City
ADDRESS_NOT_STRUCT.BLK_BTX: , Postcode: 735000, Country: Republic of TAJIKISTAN, E-mail:

CONTENTS.P: Procurement: 9062-IFT-43755
Project name: Tursun-Zade Solid Waste Project
Country: Republic of Tajikistan
Business sector: MEI
Project ID: 43755
Funding source: EBRD and EBRD SSF grant
Type of contract: Supply of Goods
Type of notice: Invitation for Tenders
Issue date: 13.4.2018
Closing date: 28.5.2018, 14:00 local time

This Invitation for Tenders follows the General Procurement Notice for this project which was published on the European Bank for Reconstruction and Development (the Bank) website, Procurement Notices (www.ebrd.com) on 12 April 2018.

Communal Enterprise “Shubai Manziliyu Kommunali va Khojagidori Dar Nazdi Makomoti Ijroiyai Hokimiyati Davlatii Shahri Tursunzoda” of Tursun-Zade City hereinafter referred to as “the Purchaser”, intends to use part of the proceeds of a loan from the Bank towards the cost of the Tursun-Zade Solid Waste Project.
The Purchaser now invites sealed tenders from Suppliers for the following Contract/s to be funded from part of the proceeds of the loan and a grant:
TZSW-OT-G03: Procurement of waste collection and general operation and maintenance vehicles:
— Lot 1: Sand-spreader truck, 7 m3, 1 truck,
— Lot 2: Pickup truck and towable disinfection unit, 1 truck and 1 disinfection unit,
— Lot 3: Truck with aerial platform, 22 m, telescopic, 1 truck,
— Lot 4: Rear loading waste compaction vehicle, 16 m3, 2 trucks.
Tenders are invited for one or more lots. Each lot must be priced separately. Tenders for more than one lot may offer discounts and such discounts will be considered in the comparison of tenders.
The delivery under each lot is required to be within 120 days from signing of the contract and all lots are to be implemented concurrently.
Tendering for contracts that are to be financed with the proceeds of a loan from the Bank is open to firms from any country.
To be qualified for the award of a Contract, Tenderers must satisfy the following minimum criteria:

1. The Tenderer, or any partner in a JVCA, shall not have a consistent history of litigation and/or arbitration resulting in awards against the Tenderer, or any partner in a JVCA, within the last five (5) years.

This determination shall be based solely on fully settled disputes or litigation. A fully settled dispute or litigation is one that has been resolved in accordance with the Dispute Resolution Mechanism under the respective Contract, and where all appeal instances available to the Tenderer have been
Exhausted.
2. All pending litigation shall in total not represent more than twenty percent (20 %) of the Tenderer’s net worth and shall be treated as resolved against the Tenderer.

3. Submission of audited balance sheets, or if not required by the law of the Tenderer’s country, other financial statements acceptable to the Purchaser, for years 2014, 2015, 2016 and 2017 (or forecasts for 2017, if accounts are not closed) to demonstrate the current soundness of the Tenderer’s financial position and its prospective long-term profitability.

4. The Tenderer must demonstrate access to, or availability of, financial resources such as free funds on current account, lines of credit dedicated to this project execution, or other similarly highly liquid financial means, in the amount not less than 90 % of the tender price per each lot to which the Tenderer applies. The Tenderer must demonstrate that the funds required for this project are free of its other commitments or sufficient to cover the overall cash flow requirements for this Contract and its current commitments
5. Experience as Supplier:
(a) Tenderer shall demonstrate that the offered type of Goods have been in the successful production and operation under similar conditions for at least last 3 (three) years, i.e. 2015-2017.

(b) Tenderer must demonstrate that they have experience as Supplier of the suggested item or similar Goods over the last 3 years, i.e. 2015-2017, under the contract/s that have been successfully and substantially completed. The similarity shall be based on the functions of machinery, complexity, methods / technology or other characteristics as described in Section VI, Supply Requirements.
Printed tender documents may be obtained from the office at the address below upon payment of a nonrefundable fee of 100 USD or equivalent in a convertible currency.

Type of notice: Invitation for Tenders

This Invitation for Tenders follows the General Procurement Notice for this project which was published on the European Bank for Reconstruction and Development (the Bank) website, Procurement Notices (www.ebrd.com) on 12 April 2018.

Communal Enterprise “Shubai Manziliyu Kommunali va Khojagidori Dar Nazdi Makomoti Ijroiyai Hokimiyati Davlatii Shahri Tursunzoda” of Tursun-Zade City hereinafter referred to as “the Purchaser”, intends to use part of the proceeds of a loan from the Bank towards the cost of the Tursun-Zade Solid Waste Project.
The Purchaser now invites sealed tenders from Suppliers for the following Contract/s to be funded from part of the proceeds of the loan and a grant:
TZSW-OT-G03: Procurement of waste collection and general operation and maintenance vehicles:
— Lot 1: Sand-spreader truck, 7 m3, 1 truck,
— Lot 2: Pickup truck and towable disinfection unit, 1 truck and 1 disinfection unit,
— Lot 3: Truck with aerial platform, 22 m, telescopic, 1 truck,
— Lot 4: Rear loading waste compaction vehicle, 16 m3, 2 trucks.
Tenders are invited for one or more lots. Each lot must be priced separately. Tenders for more than one lot may offer discounts and such discounts will be considered in the comparison of tenders.
The delivery under each lot is required to be within 120 days from signing of the contract and all lots are to be implemented concurrently.
Tendering for contracts that are to be financed with the proceeds of a loan from the Bank is open to firms from any country.
To be qualified for the award of a Contract, Tenderers must satisfy the following minimum criteria:

1. The Tenderer, or any partner in a JVCA, shall not have a consistent history of litigation and/or arbitration resulting in awards against the Tenderer, or any partner in a JVCA, within the last five (5) years.

This determination shall be based solely on fully settled disputes or litigation. A fully settled dispute or litigation is one that has been resolved in accordance with the Dispute Resolution Mechanism under the respective Contract, and where all appeal instances available to the Tenderer have been
Exhausted.
2. All pending litigation shall in total not represent more than twenty percent (20 %) of the Tenderer’s net worth and shall be treated as resolved against the Tenderer.

3. Submission of audited balance sheets, or if not required by the law of the Tenderer’s country, other financial statements acceptable to the Purchaser, for years 2014, 2015, 2016 and 2017 (or forecasts for 2017, if accounts are not closed) to demonstrate the current soundness of the Tenderer’s financial position and its prospective long-term profitability.

4. The Tenderer must demonstrate access to, or availability of, financial resources such as free funds on current account, lines of credit dedicated to this project execution, or other similarly highly liquid financial means, in the amount not less than 90 % of the tender price per each lot to which the Tenderer applies. The Tenderer must demonstrate that the funds required for this project are free of its other commitments or sufficient to cover the overall cash flow requirements for this Contract and its current commitments
5. Experience as Supplier:
(a) Tenderer shall demonstrate that the offered type of Goods have been in the successful production and operation under similar conditions for at least last 3 (three) years, i.e. 2015-2017.

(b) Tenderer must demonstrate that they have experience as Supplier of the suggested item or similar Goods over the last 3 years, i.e. 2015-2017, under the contract/s that have been successfully and substantially completed. The similarity shall be based on the functions of machinery, complexity, methods / technology or other characteristics as described in Section VI, Supply Requirements.
Printed tender documents may be obtained from the office at the address below upon payment of a nonrefundable fee of 100 USD or equivalent in a convertible currency.

Exhausted.

— Lot 1: Sand-spreader truck, 7 m3, 1 truck,
— Lot 2: Pickup truck and towable disinfection unit, 1 truck and 1 disinfection unit,
— Lot 3: Truck with aerial platform, 22 m, telescopic, 1 truck,
— Lot 4: Rear loading waste compaction vehicle, 16 m3, 2 trucks.
Tenders are invited for one or more lots. Each lot must be priced separately. Tenders for more than one lot may offer discounts and such discounts will be considered in the comparison of tenders.
The delivery under each lot is required to be within 120 days from signing of the contract and all lots are to be implemented concurrently.
Tendering for contracts that are to be financed with the proceeds of a loan from the Bank is open to firms from any country.
To be qualified for the award of a Contract, Tenderers must satisfy the following minimum criteria:

1. The Tenderer, or any partner in a JVCA, shall not have a consistent history of litigation and/or arbitration resulting in awards against the Tenderer, or any partner in a JVCA, within the last five (5) years.

This determination shall be based solely on fully settled disputes or litigation. A fully settled dispute or litigation is one that has been resolved in accordance with the Dispute Resolution Mechanism under the respective Contract, and where all appeal instances available to the Tenderer have been
Exhausted.
2. All pending litigation shall in total not represent more than twenty percent (20 %) of the Tenderer’s net worth and shall be treated as resolved against the Tenderer.

3. Submission of audited balance sheets, or if not required by the law of the Tenderer’s country, other financial statements acceptable to the Purchaser, for years 2014, 2015, 2016 and 2017 (or forecasts for 2017, if accounts are not closed) to demonstrate the current soundness of the Tenderer’s financial position and its prospective long-term profitability.

4. The Tenderer must demonstrate access to, or availability of, financial resources such as free funds on current account, lines of credit dedicated to this project execution, or other similarly highly liquid financial means, in the amount not less than 90 % of the tender price per each lot to which the Tenderer applies. The Tenderer must demonstrate that the funds required for this project are free of its other commitments or sufficient to cover the overall cash flow requirements for this Contract and its current commitments
5. Experience as Supplier:
(a) Tenderer shall demonstrate that the offered type of Goods have been in the successful production and operation under similar conditions for at least last 3 (three) years, i.e. 2015-2017.

(b) Tenderer must demonstrate that they have experience as Supplier of the suggested item or similar Goods over the last 3 years, i.e. 2015-2017, under the contract/s that have been successfully and substantially completed. The similarity shall be based on the functions of machinery, complexity, methods / technology or other characteristics as described in Section VI, Supply Requirements.
